Cell.Data: "Enneracts resurface every now and then. Those lucky enough to find them, not knowing any better, usually sell them on to be siphoned into energy crystals which fuel weapons or industry. Scholars have theorized that they may contain a small fragment of a divine entity's power, stored in an ancient but definitely manmade device. While mages may spend their life studying a few Enneracts to replicate their signature essence and cast spells, a select few are drawn to them and are able to absorb the energy within, making it theirs in an instant."
Perform a basic attack with your equipped weapon.\n\nTags: Basic Attack.
Punch your foes like your life depends on it!\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.
A Republican Instructor once told you: "So you're good at throwing punches eh? Great. Now pick up a weapon or go home". Which was a little ironic, given that the military academy was your home.
Perform a powerful Melee combo with your shield and equipped weapon.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.
Slice, hack or smash foes with your main hand weapon.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.
Human creativity knows no bounds when it comes to inventing tools of slaughter. The only thing that matches that inspiration is their desire to do it in a stylish and effective way.
Unleash a flurry of blows with both of your weapons.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.

Traditional fighters tend to consider the shield as the superior option. Clearly they have never fought the Screaming Furies of Laibon: a regiment of women dual wielding kopeshes while shouting fear away.
Swing your two handed sword to cleave your foes.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.

At the military academy your strategy teacher rambled time and time again about the battle of Samatras. The Kuei Empire's light cavalry spotted a regiment of Republican footmen isolated from the rest of the battle. A swift sweep should have been enough to break the poor infantry... except they were greatsword wielders. That day, the Republican army had horsemeat for dinner.
Maul your enemies with your two handed mace.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.

A jest only truly appreciated by battlehammer users: "Before a tournament, a knight spends two hours turtling behind three layers of thick fullplate armor. Scared of being late, he hurries in the arena and asks his unarmoured challenger "What time is it?" The lowborn picks up his maul and answers: "It's hammer time!".
Swing your two handed axe to cut down your foes.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.
Some see fighting as a dance, an art, a poetic display of murder. Meanwhile, others wield a big fat greataxe and chop people in half as casually as a butcher cuts meat. To each their own.
Unleash a flurry of blows with two daggers.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Melee.

Murderers, sociopaths and assassins all seem to share an unhealthy fetish for knives. Some researchers tried to understand this phenomenon. Their endeavour did not yield any conclusive results, given that half of them gave up after the first half got slaughtered, all with the same cause of death: multiple stabbings.
Fire at your foes with a crystal pistol.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile.
There's an old saying in the explorer's guild of Stormfall: "Do not bring a sword to a gunfight".
Fire at your foes with two crystal pistols.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile.

In the independent city of Archion there used to be an academy that taught sophisticated fighting techniques with two pistols. The training was so intense that people could be gone for years without being seen again. The world later learned that the academy had been shut down. Apparently the instructors were hiding the bodies of an absurd amount of students, dead to self-inflicted injuries.
Execute a deadly barrage of blows and shots.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile, Melee.

After several drinks of liquor, Captain James, a skypirate known for his infamous heist in the flying city of Archion, will often share his wisdom with the newbloods in his crew: "Alrigh' gather 'round ya silly skyvirgins! Everyone listen! Like oi always say, victory ain't 'bout the size of yar canons, nah it ain't, but its all 'bout...", and that's generally when he passes out.
Fire at your foes with a crystal pistol while protecting yourself with a shield.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile, Melee.

Pistol and Shield is the trademark style of the Protectors' infantry: the army of the Republic in charge of homeland security and population control. A line of Protectors handling a local riot can be a dreadful sight: the shieldwall blocks basic projectiles like paving stones, bottles and sharp sticks, and anyone getting close takes a bullet to the knee. With an order from their superior, they do not hesitate to shoot to kill.
Shoot arrows at your foes.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile.
The noble arrow, the great equalizer. A lord on his high horse, a knight with a castleforged sword, or a pitchfork-wielding peasant will all share the same fate once showered with arrows.
Tap into the staff's power to cast projectiles.\n\nTags: Basic Attack, Projectile.
Charging into battle? Muddy skirmishes? Gory eviscerations? These are peasant practices at best. Exterminating your foes from afar with magic is just more stylish... and more sanitary.
Launch a volley of arrows to the cursorâs location that deals Damage in an Area-of-Effect over time. Attack: Only usable with bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Krearion, The First Bow" so that men could master the art of raining death.
Launch a dual-blade Projectile in the cursorâs direction that deals Damage to Enemies in its path. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Rogue.

HephaÃ¤ron, Maestre of Industry, forged Omeagram, The First Double Bladed Sword, to push humans to their limits in terms of grace and agility. Manipulating this weapon can be as deadly for its wielder as it is for their foes.

Launch a Projectile to the cursorâs location that explodes, dealing Damage to Enemies in an Area-of-Effect. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Rogue, Device.

Ezaneal, Fallen Lord of Trickery, is an inventor with a brilliant mind. Ironically he uses that technology to appeal to humans' most primal desire; their lust for power. To leverage that to his advantage, he created countless death-bringing machines and devices. The "Empyrean Mortar Mark IV" is just another one of them.
Summon a hammer and bring it down in front of you, dealing Damage to Enemies in an Area-of-Effect. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
HephaÃ¤ron, Primordial of Industry, forged "Gaavanir ,The First Hammer" to shatter bones and will alike. Only dust and despair remain in its wake.

Channel multiple shots and hover or click on Enemies to target them. Projectiles are launched at the Targets when the channeling ends or the maximum Targets are selected. Attack: Only usable with bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Device.
Ezaneal, the Fallen Lord of Trickery, created incredible gun-slinging techniques while developing the first pistol, the Handheld Iosonic Cannon.

Cast a chain lightning Spell that bounces lightning between multiple Enemies, dealing decreased Lightning Damage for each subsequent Enemy it hits. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.

Beelmalik, the Fallen Lord of Punishment, used to rule over the primal element of Lightning. He kept a distinct taste for chaining attacks, representative of his desire to capture and imprison his brethren Abanazaar, Lord of Envy, and Etheliel, Lady of Vanity.
Summon a shield and charge in the cursorâs direction, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect when the charge hits an Enemy. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
BaÃ¤pheth, as the Primordial of Ambition, used the mighty shield Gleidhir, the First Shield, forged by HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, to charge recklessly into the heart of the battle.
Mark an Enemy, inflicting a number of Curse Ailment stacks on them. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Rogue.
Sarisel, Primordial of Purity, hunts all beings that are not part of Creation's original intent. His targets are tagged, meaning they are ready for purification.

Summon two daggers and dash toward a Target, hitting them and dealing Damage. When within Melee Range, the dash is omitted and the Attack triggered instantly. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Rogue.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Sazanek, The First Twinblades" by colliding two moons and transferring that power into its blade.

Summon a fireball Projectile and launch it in the cursorâs direction. The Projectile explodes when it hits an Enemy, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Projectile.

Abanazaar, the Fallen Lord of Envy, consumes all that he covets. His cravings are bottomless, absolute and destructive. Those who know how to tap into their most insane passions will understand the fiery power that the feeling contains. Shaping it into a burning ball comes with practice.

Summon a mass of ice above the cursorâs location. After a delay, the mass of ice strikes the ground, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Projectile.
Etheliel, the Fallen Lady of Vanity, sheds deadly frozen tears whenever she is confronted with the world's decay. Ruthless sorcerers learned to leverage her sorrow into chilling death.
Summon an ice Projectile and launch it in the cursorâs direction after a delay. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Projectile.

Etheliel, the Fallen Lady of Vanity, despises the use of ice as vulgar projectiles. The victims get impaled in atrocious ways which she cannot condone: they should be frozen instantly. Unfortunately, few sorcerers take these considerations into account.
Cast an ice nova that Freezes Enemies in an Area-of-Effect around you. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
Etheliel, the Fallen Lady of Vanity, wants to cover the world in ice to preserve it. Freezing friend and foe alike to trap their beauty, forever.
Launch a hook Projectile in the cursorâs direction, pulling Enemies that the hook hits to your location. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Kirenas, The First Grappling Hook" when Sarisel asked him for a tool to hunt down the evil creatures of the world.
Release a current of electricity through your sword and cut through your enemies. Can hold 2 charges. Attack: Only usable with this weapon. Skill Tags: Spell.
Lightning weapons are used by veteran Purifiers to protect the world from witchcraft. The flow of electricity is controlled by a small button on the hilt of the sword.

Launch an axe Projectile in a circle around you, dealing Damage to Enemies it hits. Base Physical damage converts into Rend damage. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.

HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Ashkadi, The First Axe" to demonstrate that the greatest momentum is birthed from imbalance. The will to right what is wrong and recreate a pristine harmony is a basic concept that organizes the great powers of the universe, and which is captured through the spin of Ashkadi.

Channel a beam in the cursorâs direction, dealing Aether Damage to Enemies within its Area-of-Effect. Turn Speed is determined by your Spell Casting Speed. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.

Anulai-Tai, the Fallen Duke of Infinity, is not nicknamed "The Last Morrow" for no reason. channelling so much of his pure Aether energy always constitutes a danger to the fabric of time, and even moreso to those standing in front of it.
Summon a spear and leap to the cursorâs location, damaging Enemies when you land in an Area-of-Effect. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Movement.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Ishmir, The First Spear" to teach men to work together on the battlefield. True warriors, however, will use this versatile weapon with lethal efficiency.
Summon a pair of chains and deal Damage with a Melee Attack combo. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
BaÃ¤pheth, the Fallen Archduke of War, used the chains that once bound him to wreak havoc upon the Army of Genesis.
Cast an Area-of-Effect around you that regenerates Health for you and your Allies. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
AnathÃ«a, Lady of Dawn, can bring her light to even the darkest depths, warming the heart of those fighting the perils of the night. The Brothers of Dawn are ever thankful for her protection.
Summon a bow and launch multiple arrow Projectiles in a spread in the cursorâs direction. The Projectiles pierce Enemies. Attack: Only usable with bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged "Krearion, The First Bow" by merging the power of a tidal wave and the accuracy of a lightning strike.
Teleport to the cursorâs location. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Movement.
Anulai-Tai, Fallen Duke of Infinity, is the master of the aether, the fabric that binds time and space. Its mastery redefines the understanding of the world, starting with the linearity of its flow.

Summon a turret at the cursorâs location that launches bullet Projectiles in the cursorâs direction. Chanel this Skill to hold the turret and direct its Projectiles. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Rogue, Device.
Ezaneal, the Fallen Lord of Trickery, invented the 'Avenger' Autoturret that fires at enemies on sight to protect his followers from raiders.
Cast a warcry that gives you and Nearby Allies an Attack Speed and Spell Casting Speed Buff. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Warrior.
BaÃ¤pheth, Fallen Archduke of War and one of the nine shadows of the world, is the father of all warriors. Channeling his power grants the ferocity needed to survive a battle.
Summon a greatsword and spin it around you, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect while moving in the cursorâs direction. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
HephaÃ¤ron, the Maestre of Industry, forged Voknafein, the First Greatsword, to push himself and humanity to the limits of their strength and creativity.

Summon a shield that absorbs Damage, exploding when its Maximum Absorption is reached or it is Cast again. The explosion deals Damage to Enemies in an Area-of-Effect. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.

HephaÃ¤ron, Maestre of Industry, is lord of the Armory of Creation. Every weapon he places within that hall spreads through the minds of men and the halls of Wolcen, and the shield Gleidhir is no exception, casting a shadow which stands hardy before those who know to call it.

Charge a spell that teleports you to the cursorâs location and creates an Area-of-Effect that deals Sacred Damage to Enemies. The Damage increases at each charge level. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Movement.

AnathÃ«a, Primordial of Dawn, descended on the defeated Army of Alia's first king and gave them the Helion. She healed their wounded and weary, and taught them that mankind's strongest weapon was hope.
Cast an Area-of-Effect at your location that grants a Buff to your Rend Damage based on your missing Health. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Warrior.
BaÃ¤pheth, Fallen Archduke of War, proved himself against Moros and the Army of Genesis by catalyzing the last strength of Bezeriel, Mortality Itself.

Launch a hammer Projectile in the direction of the cursor, dealing Damage to Enemies. The Hammer can be recalled to your location by Casting again. Attack: Only usable with melee weapons. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Warrior.

HephaÃ¤ron, Maestre of Industry, forged the first warhammer Gaavanir. When challenged on its ownership by the Primordial of Ambition, BaÃ¤pheth, he proved himself its rightful wielder when the hammer flew back to his open hand.

Charge a shot in the direction of the cursor. As the shot charges, its Area-of-Effect narrows, increasing its Damage. Base Physical Damage converts into Lightning Damage. Attack: Only usable with bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Device.

Ezaneal, Fallen Lord of Trickery, challenged HephaÃ¤ron with the claim that his Bio-Optical Targeting Interface could match any of his masterâs bows in a hunt. Taking the place of his First Man champion, Ezaneal demonstrated the superiority of his construct.
Cast a cloud at your location that makes you Invisible and decreases your Threat. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Rogue.
When Moros, Primordial of Dusk, was attacked by a jealous Abanazaar, he turned the dishonorable ambush into a pitch dark hunt between the two rivals, leveraging the forces of dusk.

Dash in the opposite direction of the cursor and launch a Projectile that Slows Enemies in an Area-of-Effect. Base Physical damage converts into Shadow damage. Attack: Only usable with daggers, bows and pistols. Skill Tags: Attack, Projectile, Rogue, Movement.

Moros, Primordial of Dusk, encouraged the Primordial of Brilliance, Ezaneal, to construct new and innovative weapons to protect mankind. In return, Ezaneal gave Moros black shells to slow his enemies.

Channel a ray from the sky that deals Sacred Damage in an Area-of-Effect over time. While channeling the ray, the Area-of-Effect moves in the cursorâs direction. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.

AnathÃ«a, Primordial Lady of Dawn, was a kind guardian to all of Creation. But when Abanazaar took chase after her as an unwanted suitor, she proved to him that the sun didnât merely warm; it scorched.

Cast an Area-of-Effect to the cursorâs location. When Enemies or Summons die within the Area-of-Effect, they explode, dealing Toxic Damage in an Area-of-Effect. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom, once used the bodies of the dead to explore obscene new perspectives of violence. His cult follows in his footsteps, the process of decomposition in warfare.
Cast a vortex to the cursorâs location that pulls in Enemies after a short time and deals Damage over time in an Area-of-Effect. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
When Anulai-Tai, Fallen Duke of Infinity, exiled himself out of time, his exit created a vortex which drained all life around it.

Summon a zombie at the cursorâs location that hits Enemies with Melee Attacks. If Maximum Summons is reached, zombies charge in the direction of the cursor. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Summon.

Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom, returns a generous boost of necrotic energy to his worshippers in exchange for sacrifices of pain, agony, and above all, plague. For this reason, his cults keep a supply of half dead hordes.

Summon a zombie at the cursorâs location that launches Projectiles. If Maximum Summons is reached, zombies launch Projectiles at the cursorâs location. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Summon.

Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom, asked AnathÃ«a for a dead sun to overlook the dead. When she refused, he corrupted her with a burst of cadaveric energy that reached from the crust of the earth to the clouds, and produced the first living dead.

Summon a zombie at the cursorâs location that generates Threat and deals Toxic Damage to Enemies with Melee Attacks. Zombie generates Threat if Cast again. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Summon.
Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom, is described as a sprawling body of rotting flesh. For this reason, his most valued worshippers modify their frames into similar shape, ever hungering for growth.

Channel a beam to a Target that transfers their Health to you until they become possessed. Once possessed, the Target becomes an Ally and their Health is restored. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell, Summon.
Bezeriel, Fallen Archduke of Doom, is worshipped through a variety of cruel strange means. One of these is The Sweet Tooth Worm gorges itself on decaying flesh and produces necrotic effects.
Hit Enemies within Melee range multiple times with a combo, generating Willpower per Enemy hit. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
Anulai-Tai, Fallen Archduke of Infinity, wove the fabric of time when called into existence by the First Movement of Creation.
Cast a cone of force in the cursorâs direction that Knocks Back and Stuns Enemies and destroys Projectiles. Spell: Only usable with staves or catalysts. Skill Tags: Spell.
Moros, Primordial of Dusk, wielded great clouds of darkness to turn the tide of battle when his forces seemed surrounded.
SKILLS VARIANTS <font color="#cb5316"> Rage <font color="#948ec6"> Willpower
Decreases the Cooldown of this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Enemies within this Skill's Area-of-Effect become Slowed.
The Skill's Damage is dealt immediately after being Cast, but Damage is decreased.
Converts base Physical Damage to Fire Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

Abanazaar, once Primordial of Fire, ravaged a continent pursuing his unrequited love, his envy consuming and melting everything, the ground itself turning to lava in his wake.\n\nWhile HephaÃ¤ron was his enemy, he remained a keen opportunist. He got to work, installing a forge near the melting continent and shaping its burning metals into superdense flaming arrowheads meant to feed the mouth of Krearion.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Arrows become a vertical barrage that creeps forward slowly.

Krearion was forged with the ability to soak up the surrounding static energy and release it as sheer force whenever unleashing volleys of arrows. The energy generated by the projectiles creates a virtuous loop that allows attacks to advance across the battlefield with minimal effort from the archer.
This Skill's keybind can now be pressed and held to increase the Damage it deals when it is Cast.
Increases the Critical Chance Score for yourself and Nearby Allies when you Cast this Skill.
Killing an Enemy decreases the Cooldown of this Skill.

Scholars and logisticians have theorized that the impact of sustained fire on a specific battlefield area has heavily disminishing returns in terms of efficiency. Accuracy and restraint allow for a more strategic approach that saves a considerable amount of resources for roughly similar results.
The Damage of this Skill is multiplied per Enemy within its Area-of-Effect.
Gives this Skill a Chance to summon an Ally that Casts two smaller Area-of-Effects around yours.
Increases Ailment Damage of Ailments inflicted with this Skill.
Increases Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Decreases the Rage Cost of this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Decreases the time taken for this Skill to regenerate a Charge.
The Projectile of this Skill circles around the cursor's location.

When Abanazaar, once Primordial of Fire, crossed an ocean to meet his unrequited love, it created a tempestuous cyclone made of scorching steam. It is said that to tame the cyclone, HephaÃ¤ron started forging Omeagram in the eye of the storm to redirect its power into the legendary blade.
Converts base Physical Damage to Toxic Damage.\n\nAn additional Ailment stack is inflicted when inflicting the Poison Ailment with this Skill.

While cleansing a village captured by Bezerielâs followers, Sarisel encountered an Immortal Maw, one of the Fallen Archduke of Doom's gluttonous minions. These high-ranking cultists serve Bezeriel through mirroring his behaviour, consuming all dead flesh they encounter. The Immortal Maw swallowed Omeagram, its reinforced gullet enduring the internal damage, so Sarisel was forced to tear apart its immense, obese carcass with his bare hands. Omeagram became tainted with the necrotic poison of Bezeriel, rendering it impure, and thus Sarisel banished it to HephaÃ¤ron's Armoury of Creation.
This Skill's Maximum number of Charges is increased by 1.
The Projectile of this Skill immobilizes Enemies.
If you Cast this Skill again while its Projectile is still active, you teleport to the location of the Projectile.
This Skill leaves an Area-of-Effect in its trail for a few seconds that deals Damage.
The Projectile of this Skill transmits Ailments from one Enemy to another.

The taint carried by Omeagram after its encounter with the Immortal Maw was such that it transmitted a pestilence to all surrounding things. HephaÃ¤ron built a case for it, forged from Primordial Steel, where the blade stewed in its own fumes only gaining in toxicity.
The Projectile of this Skill causes the first Enemy it hits to explode after a few seconds, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.
Converts base Physical Damage to Frost Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

The edges of Omeagram were keened with such precision that HephaÃ¤ron boasted its ability to cut through anything if thrown with enough might, even time and space. No volunteer dared to test the claim with their own body, thus no-one questioned the terrifying sharpness of the blades, which were as cold as his heart.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt with Ailments inflicted by this Skill.
Decreases the minimum Range of this Skill.
Enemies within this Skill's Area-of-Effect become Slowed.
An additional Projectile is launched by this Skill.\n\nDecreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Converts Physical Damage to Rend Damage.\n\nAn additional Ailment stack is inflicted when inflicting the Bleed Ailment with this Skill.

Anything can be infused with power through faith and rituals. Explosive powder is no different. The Empyrean Mortar's ammunitions use powder steeped in viscera which is consecrated by fanatics of Ezaneal's cult in gory rituals.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
The Projectile of this Skill becomes a Mine that explodes when an Enemy is Nearby.

Deep beneath the treacherous sands of the Laibonite desert can be found an underground laboratory used by the brightest followers of Ezaneal. These twisted cultists are experimenters that would sacrifice anything to further their research. They despise disturbances so much that they mined an absurdly large perimeter around the facility, making the whole region a deadzone in the process.
Explosions caused by this Skill cause a cluster of smaller explosions around it.

The Empyrean Mortar was designed to have schematics understandable by humans. Unsatisfied with the lack of elegance that these constraints placed upon his creation, he iterated up to the Mark IV. This version requires primordial metal and uses an incredible amount of energy which lifts it up to Ezaneal's standards while making it totally unreproducible by mortals. In doing so, this unique model failed in its primary purpose: accessibility.
Launches multiple Projectiles in quick succession, but decreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.\n\nA Cooldown is added to this Skill.
The Projectile of this Skill become a rocket that travels in a straight line when launched. The explosion's Area-of-Effect is decreased, but the Damage dealt with this Skill is increased.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt with Ailments inflicted by this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
An additional Projectile is launched by this Skill.\n\nDecreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Reduces the Rage Cost of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill when it hits Enemies that are Stunned.
Converts base Physical Damage to Lightning Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

When battlehammers were revealed to humans, mortal war became a much more tempestuous affair. The sharpening of swords gave way to the forging of maces, the rumbling thunder of a building storm. Battles became cacophonies of dull clangs as plate mail caved under the pressure of maul strikes and bones cracked sharply, a thundering hurricane littered with strikes of Lightning. Gaavanir is the embodiment of such a storm.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Allows you to charge this Skill to increase the Damage it deals.

Gaavanir slumbers in the Armory of Creation. Its very existence inspired the concept of battlehammers to craftsmen and blacksmiths around the world. Ever since, battlefields have been littered with broken skulls and crushed rib cages.
Casting this Skill causes a chain of explosions in front of you that deal Damage.

Every battlehammer in Wolcen is a mere shadow of Gaavanir. The destruction they have wrought is nothing compared to what HephaÃ¤ronâs hammer would unleash upon mortal existence. In those few moments where BaÃ¤pheth tried Gaavanir, the Earth shook and brought on a chain reaction that caused every volcano to spit fire. Since then, it has slept.
Increases the Attack Speed Score of this Skill.\n\nDecreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Gives this Skill the Chance to summon an Ally that inflicts one Hit on the Enemy hit by this Skill.
Critical Hits inflict Stun on Enemies.\n\nA Cooldown is added to this Skill.
Critical Hits inflicted with this Skill have a Chance to Cast a chain lightning Skill that deals Damage based on this Skill's Weapon Damage.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt with Ailments inflicted by this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Reduces the Rage Cost of this Skill.
Increases the number of Enemies that can be targeted by this Skill.
Each of this Skill's Projectiles that hits an Enemy deals damage in an Area-of-Effect.

During his banishment to the Abyss, Ezaneal became more and more obsessed with proving his worth as an inventor. His explosive projectile design was so readily rejected by HephaÃ¤ron... What if it could be faster, more direct, more complex, more chaotic? He repeatedly swore to himself that he would overshadow his former master, render his elitist conventions obsolete and fill the world with his chaotic creations; weapons that equalize the playing field, giving anyone the chance to succeed.
Converts base Physical Damage to Aether Damage.\n\nIncreases the Stasis Chance Score of this Skill.

After much experimentation and a handful of explosive accidents, Ezaneal created the Handheld Iosonic Cannon, the First Pistol. Its pinpoint accuracy, light weight and ability to shift its traversal of aether to high speeds made it extremely deadly. Giving humanity weapons of this nature, so accessible and deadly, would no doubt cause chaos, but HephaÃ¤ron had sealed the Armory of Creation permanently. This was the only way to share his invention with humanity; it would take a genius to get insideâ¦
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.

The embodiment of purity is considered to be many things depending on perspective: one of the last Primordials is a lethal purifier, or the apex of all demonhunters. He is a relentless killer of all that he deems unworthy of Creation's prime vision. Sarisel isn't known for his tolerance or empathy. He is a killer, a punisher, a purifier. He destroys all those that he associates with the evils of the world and the abominations they create. Once Marked by Impurity, there is no explanation, no second chance and no justice, just blind purification for all involved.

Sarisel buries his weapons in the ground when they have soaked up too much blood, justifying that no thing tainted with evil in its essence could possibly do good. They remain in the ground, seeming like the bones of the world. These relics of Primordial sins have a power, emanating a curse on the towns built above. Not only do they draw the life from all things above that once thrived, but they invite hate and gratuitous violence among the people on the surface.

Merging two moons inside something as tiny as a blade is a dangerous endeavor even for a Primordial. Without proper mastery the resulting object could become so dense that it would crumble and become an all-devouring black hole. This intense power can manipulate time and space itself.

Some Brothers chose to fight off this faithlessness by becoming "Hierophants of the Searing Song", battlepriests that preach her prayers and blessings to shield mankind from evil.

While inside this Skill's Area-of-Effect, your Stamina Regeneration is increased.
This Skill's Area-of-Effect follows the player it was Cast to.

The Brotherhood of Dawn worships AnathÃ«a. Even after being chased from the Kingdom of Alia once the United Republic of Mankind took over, they stayed true to their oaths and remained powerful knights, shielding innocents from the terrors of the night.
While inside this Skill's Area-of-Effect, your Ailment Chance Score is increased.
While inside this Skill's Area-of-Effect, your Force Shield regenerates.
Decreases the Cooldown of this Skill.
Increases the Healing Rate of this Skill's Area-of-Effect.
Decreases the Willpower Cost of this Skill.

Projectiles launched by this Skill explode when they hit an Enemy, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.\n\nRemoves this Skill's Pierce Strength.

While HephaÃ¤ron built Krearion, his apprentice was in charge of creating its arrows. He experimented with the design, and decided on an explosive arrowhead as standard. HephaÃ¤ron was furious and claimed that the apprentice was unable to understand the purity of his design. Such crass, mindless violence contrasts with HephaÃ¤ronâs finely crafted weapons that carried out their function efficiently and with simplicity. This disagreement was the first step towards eccentricity that led Ezaneal to be the devious inventor he is today.
Converts base Physical Damage to Toxic Damage.\n\nAn additional Ailment stack is inflicted when inflicting the Poison Ailment with this Skill.

The bow is the most common weapon for hunters in the cult of Bezeriel. As they collect flesh for him to consume, yanking out the arrows from the corpses, the arrowheads become more and more putrid as the gory residue builds up between each kill. It rots over time, making each shot ever more lethal.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Additional Projectiles are launched by this Skill
Gives this Skill the Chance to summon an Ally that will launch Projectiles at your Targets alongside you.
Gives this Skill the Chance to summon an Ally that inflicts one Hit on the Enemy hit by this Skill.
Increases your Casting Speed with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt by each of this Skill's Projectiles based on their remaining Pierce Strength.
This Skill's keybind can now be pressed and held to queue arrow volleys that will be launched consecutively when the keybind is released.

The creation of Krearion served as inspiration for all humans to create their own bows. As archery became more widespread, Krearion gathered power within itself, which cried out in great volleys. For every bow strung, Krearionâs shadow is cast wider and longer than ever.
Converts base Physical Damage to Frost Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

Those wanderers from the most hostile regions of Varg speak of a legend. A lone wandering figure in furs, whose arrows turn their target into statues of ice. Some believe him an envoy of a higher power. Others still believe that his arrows are the product of some advanced craft, and that his technique might be uncovered if one adventures far enough into his territory.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the maximum Range of the teleport.
Enemies near the beginning and end of the teleport are inflicted with Stasis.
You generate Willpower for each enemy you travel through when you teleport.
Enemies around the cursor's location swap locations with you when you teleport.

After a certain threshold, mastering the Aether drifts in focus. The temptation to use it to reshape the world becomes irresistible, regardless of the risks of butterfly effect. Manipulating it from afar and remoulding the thread that connects every being to it becomes a nefarious call that eventually leads to a failing moral system and a predatory behaviour to toy with one's prey in the pursuit of selfish desires.
A Decoy that generates Threat is left at your previous location when you complete a teleport.
Aether Damage is dealt to Enemies between the start and end points of the teleport. \n\nIncreases the Stasis Chance Score of this Skill.
Casting this Skill removes all Crowd Control Effects that are affecting you.
Decreases the Cooldown of this Skill\n\nEach successive Cast of this Skill has an increased Willpower Cost if the Cast occurs within a certain timeframe.

The most powerful sorcerers of the cult of Infinity aim to mimic their Fallen overlord. They have partially severed their link to time itself, allowing them to move through the Aether motionlessly at an uncanny speed.
Increases your Attack Speed Score and Spell Casting Speed Score after this Skill has been Cast.
If Cast again within a certain timeframe, you will teleport to the start point of your previous teleport.

Deconstructing time allows the possibility to create minor anomalies. To shape things in a way that should not be possible. Something even Primordials have trouble achieving is the teleportation recoil effect. The act of teleporting does not only consume energy: it condenses it in an unstable cluster, which may on implosion cause teleportation to recur a number of times, occasionally trapping the subject in an infinite loop.
Increases your Movement Speed after this Skill has been Cast.
Decreases the Willpower Cost of this Skill.
Decreases the Cooldown of this Skill
You generate Willpower for each enemy you travel through when you teleport.
Decreases the Willpower Cost of this Skill.
Increases the maximum Range of the teleport.
Increases the duration that the turret remains active.
Increases the Damage dealt by the turret.
An additional cannon is added to the turret, increasing the Damage it deals.
Projectiles launched by the turret explode when they hit an Enemy, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.

For a while there was harmony between the two groups, despite their differences. The agreement provided mutual security and allowed the city to prosper. However, discontent started brewing when The Cult of Beelmalik sabotaged some of the turrets, blaming shoddy craftsmanship and turning public opinion against the refugees. But the turrets remained, defending the city with complete neutrality.
Converts base Physical Damage to Lightning Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt by this Skill.

Long ago, there was an underground city of scholars and craftsmen. However, it was constantly threatened by their fellow subterranean settlers, the Svriir. A group of refugees, followers of Ezaneal, offered to build defences for the city in exchange for shelter and tributes to the Fallen Lord of Trickery. A deal was struck, and the cultists constructed automatic turrets to protect the city.
When the turret is destroyed, it explodes, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Allows the turret to rotate and target Enemies.

Long ago, there was an underground city of scholars and craftsmen. It was constantly threatened by the Svriir who dominated their subterranean domains. A group of refugees, followers of Ezaneal, offered to build defences for the city in exchange for shelter and tributes to the Fallen Lord of Trickery. A deal was struck, and the cultists constructed automatic turrets to protect the city.
Allows this Skill to have two turrets active simultaneously.
Increases the Movement Speed of your allies in an Area-of-Effect around the turret.
Creates a shield that rotates with the turret, Blocking incoming Projectiles.

The tributes to Ezaneal slowed and soon stopped all together. The furious cultists precipitated a schism with the Cultists of Beelmalik. Each turned their faulty cannons towards each other and swore that their weapons would strike down the cityâs enemies. Yet, there was no shot. The town remained paralyzed, each fearing that they would be the one struck down if fire broke out. Centuries after, the inhabitants still suspect that tomorrow will sound the crack of their mutual destruction.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt by the turret.\n\nDecreases the duration that the turret remains active.

The warcry inflicts Stun on Enemies within its Area-of-Effect.

BaÃ¤pheth is a born conqueror. But far from being a mindless battlebeast, he turned out to be a patient strategist. He understands that battles are won long before soldiers ever set foot on the field. The successful belligerent breaks the will of his foes long before breaking their bones.
The warcry inflicts Weakness on Enemies within its Area-of-Effect.
Increases the duration of all Buffs granted by this Skill.
Increases the effectiveness of all Buffs granted by this Skill and other Skills.
The warcry removes Crowd Control Effects from you and your Allies.

Before becoming the Fallen of War, BaÃ¤pheth used to be the Primordial of Ambition. Part of his hubris came from his willingness to embody the perfect warrior. To be a figure that others could look up to in their darkest times. When others would consider breaking the line, he would not relent and would command them to stand with him. Most would mistake his quest for glory for a heroism that never was.
The warcry grants a Buff to your Life Leech.
The warcry grants a Buff to your Block Chance.
The warcry grants a Buff to your Critical Chance Score.
The warcry grants a Buff to your Movement Speed.
Gives the warcry a Chance to Frenzy Enemies.

During the great War of the Primordials, BaÃ¤pheth engaged and fought against AnathÃ«a, the Lady of Dawn. While The First Warrior's prowess could not be matched in battle, AnathÃ«a's resisted his frenzying shouts and her raw power was still enough to rival him for a while. \n\nIn the end, BaÃ¤pheth had the upper hand and wounded AnathÃ«a, some of her lights escaped her body uncontrollably, engulfing and searing BaÃ¤pheth inside and out. Both were considerably weakened by the experience and unable to land the final blow.
Decreases the Rage Cost of this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
This Skill's keybind can now be pressed and held to increase the duration of the Skill.

HephaÃ¤ron learned of a rare material, Shiganite, that was as strong as Primordial metal, less brittle but more dense. He collected some of this unique ore from the high mountains of Wolcen and started work in his cliffside workshop. In his forge, HephaÃ¤ron soon discovered the metal was extremely unstable; to maintain its integrity, he created a long blade with a Shiganite core and a thick Primordial metal outer layer, which came to be known as Voknafein, The First Greatsword.
Converts base Physical Damage to Frost Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

As HephaÃ¤ron continued to improve his swordsmanship, he heard a mournful shriek echo through the mountains, accompanied by an icy chill. As Ethelielâs lament passed through the mountain range, it disturbed a large mass of snow. It slowly began to slide down the mountain, picking up speed until it became a full-blown avalanche barrelling towards the workshop. With no time to react, HephaÃ¤ron planted his sword into the earth and gripped it tightly to endure the cascade of ice.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases this Skill's Area-of-Effect.\n\nDecreases the tick-rate of the Damage dealt with this Skill.
When Cast, this Skill grants a Buff to your Attack Speed. Allies within this Skill's Area-of-Effect also receive this Buff.

Critical Hits inflicted with this Skill increases its Damage tick-rate.
Increases your Critical Chance Score when an Enemy is killed with this Skill.
A shockwave is released after this Skill is Cast that deals Damage to Enemies.
Incoming Enemy Projectiles are re-directed when this Skill is active.

HephaÃ¤ron was frustrated; he could barely carry the weapon, let alone use it. Despite his best efforts, the sword refused to stay upright. He asked BaÃ¤pheth, the First Warrior to test the weapon. BaÃ¤pheth held the sword high, feeling its crushing weight, then switched stance so that the weapon fell behind him. He launched into a sequence of spinning strikes, sending shockwaves of air bursting in all directions. BaÃ¤phethâs only comment: the sword needed a heavier pommel, to balance out the dense blade.
Increases the Damage dealt by this Skill for every Ailment stack an Enemy has.
Adds an additional attack to this Skill's combo.
Adds an additional attack to this Skill's combo.
You generate Willpower when inflicting Critical Hits with this Skill.
You generate Willpower each time an Enemy is killed with this Skill.
Inflicts a Debuff on Enemies when hit with this Skill that increases the Damage they receive from Spells.
Increases the Damage dealt on the next Hit you inflict after Casting this Skill.

Anulai-Tai, who would once become the Fallen Archduke of Infinity, was invested with a great kindness in his early days. Slipping through the non-linear chaos, he wove pins into the aether and constructed the fabric of time. At its center, the many threads in the needles found their anchor point in Anulai-Tai himself. His sacrifice meant that life flourished for mortal beings.
When Cast, this Skill grants a Buff to the Damage Nearby Allies deal with the base Damage Type of this Skill.
Gives this Skill the Chance to summon an Ally that inflicts one Hit on an Enemy when they are hit with this Skill.
Force Shield is regenerated per Enemy hit with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill while you have Force Shield remaining.
Increases your Block Chance while casting this Skill. Enemy Hits that are Blocked inflict Stasis on that Enemy.

Over the course of history, the threads bound to Anulai-Tai began to torture him, pulling him every which way. He soon came to despise timeâs movements and desired them to stop. Moros tried to relieve his burden. While he could never understand the design of the aethereal weave, he held the tapestry together for a time. This legendary era was called the Boundless Dusk, as Morosâ darkness stretched through time while he replaced Anulai-Tai.
Increases the Damage dealt by this Skill for every Ailment stack an Enemy has.
Converts base Aether Damage into Shadow Damage.\n\nIncreases the Curse Chance Score of this Skill.

When AnathÃ«a and Moros danced in the First Movement of Creation, the world was naked before the chaotic movements of the universe. If there were to be men, there needed to be a realm governed by rules which they could live in. Anulai-Tai was commanded into existence by this cosmic lack.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
This Skill steals Willpower from Enemies instead of Health.
Increases the tick-rate of the stealing Effect for every Ailment stack an Enemy has.

The Sweet Tooth Worm causes a deep craving for sugar in order to provoke diabetic necrosis in the host body. The worm feasts on this rotting flesh storing it external skin sacks.  If put into contact with freezing temperatures, the Sweet Tooth will immediately enter hibernation and survive off of its supplies. This is the best time to collect them as spellcasting components. Some, such as the faithful of Bezeriel, raise them in warm pools in order to use them sustainably.
Increases how much is stolen when the stealing Effect ticks.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Chance that Health Globes will drop from Enemies affected by this Skill.
This Skill steals Force Shield from Enemies instead of Health.
Allows the Skill to target Allies, transferring Health from you to your Allies.

The Sweet Tooth Worm strongly prefers rotting meat due to the small insects it attracts, and the heat generated by putrefaction. But if starved, they can be persuaded to partake in living meat, carrying the vital energy from one subject to another. Peasants are quick to stack them into their baskets to sell them to the nearest doctor, exposing themselves to the Sweet Wormâs deadly contagion.
Possessed Enemies drop Health Globes when they are killed.
Converts base Toxic Damage to Shadow Damage.\n\nIncreases the Curse Chance Score of this Skill.

Underneath each Temple of Bezeriel lies a broad green pool. The priests will open the gates to that underground refuge once per season, allowing filth encrusted beggars to rush in for a bath. Thereâs a tacit understanding between the priests and the beggars. Everyone has heard the rumours after all: the shadows have allowed something to proliferate in the water. Those who enter them will take something away, hidden underneath their skin.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.
Increases the Critical Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.\n\nDecreases the tick-rate of the stealing effect.
Increases the size of your Summons, increasing their Health and the Damage they deal.\n\nDecreases the number of Summons you can summon.

As the Primordial of Mortality, Bezeriel concerned himself with Death as a separation of soul and body. As a Fallen, his presence on Wolcen is more akin to an open gullet siphoning faith. One worshipper in agony has prayers worth five healthy parishioners, and one class of victim produces more necrotic power than any other: the sick.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.\n\nDecreases the Health of Summons.
Summons explode when they are killed or when they hit an Enemy during a charge, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.

Plague acts as an effective recruitment tool. The cult creates an underclass of lepers, then offer them shelter where no one else will grant it. This results in a steady supply of cannon fodder, all too eager to release themselves into death during the battle.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons when they explode.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Fire Damage.

The Hierarch of Infestation once declared outright war upon the worshippers of AnathÃ«a. Targeting a temple north of Varg, where the days are longest, the Shepherds of Plague gathered the sickly beggars put under their protection into a ditch. They doused the wretches with oil and cast a fire into the pit. Desperate for aid and relief, the flaming forces ran amok, devastating the Temple of Dawn.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Aether Damage.

The Cult of Doom draws its mystical power from prolonged suffering, and is ever searching for new means to cause pain. For this purpose, they invited representatives of the Cult of Infinity. The wards of the Hierarch of Infestation were subjected to the agonies of time condensed into seconds, their flesh morphing and withering faster than they should possibly be allowed to. From this torment, the Shepherds of Plague found a new sub-variety of energy available to them.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Toxic Damage.

The creation of a servile workforce involves the deliberate contamination of food and water resources within a given community. Nearby collectivities are quick to quarantine the area and cease all trade, thus leaving the sick in a needy position. The cult of Doom appears almost as a hero, willing to entreat with the lepers where no one else would.
Increases the number of Summons you can summon.
Increases Summons' Health.\n\nDecreases the number of Summons you can summon.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases Summons' Movement Speed.\n\nIncreases Summons' Health.
Projectiles launched by Summons explode when they hit an Enemy, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.

Bezeriel devised a plan to elevate the bodies of the dead up into the sky, to touch AnathÃ«a who had never known mortality. He rejoiced as Deathâs rot began to spread inside AnathÃ«aâs belly, the sparks of light and plasma in her body collapsing into smoke and ashes. She vomited this tainted matter onto Wolcen, barely saving herself. The regurgitated dead stood up from the waste, when they ought never to stand again. The power of the sun had granted them a semblance of new life.
Projectiles launched by Summons have a Pierce Strength.
Increases Summons' Attack Speed after the Skill is Cast to focus fire on the cursor's location.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.\n\nDecreases Summons' Health.

Though Bezeriel couldnât obtain a dead sun from AnathÃ«a, his curiosity was peaked by the new form of unlife produced by her brush with death. He shepherded the revenants and taught them to spread their state of being to the First Men. This conflict had allowed consciousness to triumph over the bodyâs limits.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Toxic Damage.

The hunters of Bezeriel were mistakenly thought to be clumsy shooters, always missing the vital spots in their prey. Little did those gossiping witnesses know that the archers of Doom didnât desire to kill. The tips of their arrows were covered in hazardous contaminants. Those beasts and men who were struck by them would carry infection wherever they went, spreading the Hierarch of Infestationâs design around the world.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Frost Damage.

The northmost cults of Bezeriel infringed upon Ethelielâs territory, thereby spreading their own power. Their sacrifices would be buried up to the neck in snow, left to die a slow death of cold. From there, the body would naturally mummify in the ice, mutating into a new form. The Diamond Legion protects these mummies, as their peaceful expressions and smooth skins reflect Ethelielâs ideals.
Converts Summons' base Physical Damage to Shadow Damage.

As the first generations of the First Men died out, Bezeriel frowned. It seemed unfair that the dead should have no sun of their own though they far outnumbered the living. He went to AnathÃ«a and asked her to give him a dead sun which would oversee the Ailing Marshes where lie those who die of sickness. AnathÃ«a rejected Bezerielâs request: creating a new sun would be akin to abandoning a child to Bezeriel. The then-lord of mortality resolved that if AnathÃ«a wouldnât help him, he would corrupt her himself with a great burst of necrotic energy.
Increases the number of Summons you can summon.
Decreases the number of Summons you can summon.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summons.
Increases Summons' Movement Speed.\n\nIncreases Summons' Health.
Summons drop Health Globes when they are killed.

The candidates are invited into a room half-mortuary, half-theater. There, they consume the rotten flesh of the dead, take brown blood into their veins, sew pieces of the cadavers onto themselves. That is the first week. Should the candidate survive it, the transformation into an Immortal Maw takes place over a month. The subjectâs body turns bloated and purple and emits a putrid sheen. Gums recede to show oversized fangs. A hunger buries itself in the pit of their stomachs, which must be sated by flesh yet will go on hungering. They walk behind the Shepherds of Plague, ready to take any attacks thrown at them. This is what it means to embrace Bezeriel.
Summon receives a portion of the Damage dealt to you.

Like all religious cloisters, the Cult of Bezeriel invites competition between its believers, but they may hold the most perverse incarnation of this phenomenon. The Shepherds speak in demeaning terms to their parish, comparing them unfavorably to those who make the ultimate sacrifice: the Immortal Maws. They used to be men, believers who once aspired to the priesthood. The process to change into an Immortal Maw kills most who attempt it, and yet they are honoured as their death brings vigor to the cult.
Converts summons' base Toxic Damage to Shadow Damage.\n\nSummon gains a Skill that allows them to leap onto Enemies, dealing Damage.

When Moros attempted to lull Bezeriel into an eternal sleep, he and all his faithful were condemned to act as the Primordial of Doom's warden. Moros' devotees march, corraling the Immortal Maws into place.
Converts summons' base Toxic Damage to Lightning Damage.\n\nSummon gains a Skill that allows them to summon a shield that Blocks incoming Damage.

The flair of justice still runs through Beelmalik, even in his Fallen state. His faithful Punishers hunt the cultists of Bezeriel, paying special attention to the Immortal Maws who stand as the cultâs greatest achievement, and its most repugnant crime. They lash at their backs with lightning. For those that fall, it is a mercy. Those that live will become an everlasting example in their hands.
When Cast, this Skill has a Chance to Frenzy enemies in an Area-of-Effect around the Summon.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summon.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summon.
Increases the Damage dealt by Summon.
Summon generates more Threat.\n\nIncreases Summons' Health.
The vortex pulls in Enemies multiple times.

The vortex left behind by Anulai-Taiâs exit was so strong that those who resisted its pull saw the blood drain out through their skin, helplessly inhaled by the eye of the storm. The raw magic contained in the water and soil crystallized towards the surface before being ripped from the earth. In abandoning time, Anulai-Tai had forced those left behind to confront it.
Increases your Movement Speed while you are within this Skill's Area-of-Effect.
Projectiles are destroyed by the Area-of-Effect.\n\nIncreases the Cooldown of this Skill.
This Skill deals Damage to Enemies when they are pulled into the vortex.
Allows this Skill to have two vortexes active simultaneously.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt to Enemies within the vortex's Area-of-Effect.
Health Globes pulled into the vortex explode, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.

The hole in the Aether's weave has to this day peculiar effects on the weather, with the movements of time causing sudden shifts in the atmosphere and tidal alterations. Vorticial thunderstorms spell certain death for sailors, and have contributed to the Sea of Tormentâs reputation.
Increases the duration of the vortex.
When this Skill is Cast while a vortex is still active, the vortex explodes, dealing Damage in an Area-of-Effect.
Converts base Aether Damage to Lightning Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

Anulai-Tai emerged from the First Movement of Creation. He weaved an intricate tapestry from the aether, organising it into time. As the threads of that weave tied into his body, Anulai-Tai suffered from its inexorable motion. Warped by his suffering, he came to tear himself from the strings, digging and digging until at last, he had found his way out. The opening he left behind pulsed like a beating heart, dragging all things into itself like a hungry maw.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.

Increases the Critical Damage dealt with this Skill.

The Cult of Doom holds thousands of prisoners agonizing in pestilence within their dungeons. Theyâre technically alive, but their flesh can be coaxed into the transformations of death. Within minutes, the human body can double in size as its tissues collapse and release toxins. The flesh swells, releasing a burst of necrotic energy at breaking point. The resulting creatures are at the cult's disposal, ready to be unleashed for their dark purposes.
Whenever an Enemy or Summon is killed by this Skill, they leave behind an Area-of-Effect that deals Toxic Damage over time.

While the practices of the Cult of Doom are horrifying, they are not usually bombastic. The Hierarch of Infestation is an enthusiast of all protracted suffering and slow decay. He feeds and feeds and feeds the beast-Fallen Bezeriel, who exudes energies both poisonous and healing in return.
Converts base Toxic Damage to Fire Damage.\n\nIncreases the Damage dealt with this Skill.

While Bezeriel has direct control over the process of decomposition, his cults have to contend with worshipping a dead god and the limits of his reach. There are more prosaic ways of weaponizing the human body. If one places a mine underneath the bodies of the dead, some dutiful comrade or bereaved relative is certain to come collecting.
Increases the Damage dealt with this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Chance Score of this Skill.
Increases the Ailment Damage dealt by Ailments inflicted with this Skill.

Abanazaar caught up to AnathÃ«a and tried to plead his case. After all, had fire not spread where her light had dried the land? Was she not able of scorching, burning, and destroying as he was? She recognized the inclination towards fire within her yet turned him away, for she regretted such destructive impulses within herself. In such things did Moros balance her, in a way that Abanazaar could not
While inside this Skill's Area-of-Effect, you and your Allies are granted an All Resistances Score Buff.
